author: TravisEz13
body:
- [X] Resolves issue #1600.
- [X] Code is [rebased](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/git/README.md#sync-your-local-repo) on `origin/master`.
- [N/A] Add tests that fail without your changes.
- [ ] Update all relevant [documentation](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/tree/master/docs).

comments.author: vors
comments.body: Lets hold on this change until we figure out why it didn't pick it up at the first place.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: @vors It looks like dotnet-cli would choose a matching nuget package over a subproject. The nuget package "Microsoft.WSMan.Management 1.0.1-rc1" is still available in our appveyor feed.

comments.author: vors
comments.body: @daxian-dbw I don't think so, it preferred projects over packages.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
vors
comments.body: Great! @TravisEz13 can you also rename the AssemlbyInfo.cs file to the correct name that @alexandair pointed out?

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: I believe that was a typo in my previous PR which has been removed.

title: Compile WSMan binaries when compiling for dot net core
